Name: ClosingAvailable
Definition: Closing balance of amount of money that is at the disposal of the account owner on the date specified.

Name: ClosingBooked
Definition: Balance of the account at the end of the pre-agreed account reporting period. It is the sum of the opening booked balance at the beginning of the period and all entries booked to the account during the pre-agreed account reporting period.

Name: Expected
Definition: Balance, composed of booked entries and pending items known at the time of calculation , which projects the end of day balance if everything is booked on the account and no other entry is posted.

Name: ForwardAvailable
Definition: Forward available balance of money that is at the disposal of the account owner on the date specified.

Name: Information
Definition: Balance for informational purposes.

Name: InterimAvailable
Definition: Available balance calculated in the course of the account servicer's business day, at the time specified, and subject to further changes during the business day. The interim balance is calculated on the basis of booked credit and debit items during the calculation time/period specified.

Name: InterimBooked
Definition: Balance calculated in the course of the account servicer's business day, at the time specified, and subject to further changes during the business day. The interim balance is calculated on the basis of booked credit and debit items during the calculation time/period specified.

Name: OpeningAvailable
Definition: Opening balance of amount of money that is at the disposal of the account owner on the date specified.

Name: OpeningBooked
Definition: Book balance of the account at the beginning of the account reporting period. It always equals the closing book balance from the previous report.

Name: PreviouslyClosedBooked
Definition:
Balance of the account at the previously closed account reporting period. The opening booked balance for the new period has to be equal to this balance. 
Usage: the previously booked closing balance should equal (inclusive date) the booked closing balance of the date it references and equal the actual booked opening balance of the current date. Balance of the account at the previously closed account reporting period. The opening booked balance for the new period has to be equal to this balance. 
Usage: the previously booked closing balance should equal (inclusive date) the booked closing balance of the date it references and equal the actual booked opening balance of the current date. Balance of the account at the previously closed account reporting period. The opening booked balance for the new period has to be equal to this balance. 
Usage: the previously booked closing balance should equal (inclusive date) the booked closing balance of the date it references and equal the actual booked opening balance of the current date.

Name: Credit
Definition: Operation is a credit

No

Name: Debit
Definition: Operation is a debit
Standard ISO 20022 Definition:
No
Standard is "Operation is an decrease." - which may be ambigious.No
Standard is "Operation is an decrease." - which may be ambigious.No
Standard is "Operation is an decrease." - which may be ambigious.

Name: Booked
Definition:
Booked means that the transfer of money has been completed between account servicer and account owner
Usage :
Status Booked does not necessarily imply finality of money as this depends on other factors such as the payment system used, the completion of the end- to-end transaction and the terms agreed between account servicer and owner.
Status Booked is the only status that can be reversed.Booked means that the transfer of money has been completed between account servicer and account owner
Usage :
Status Booked does not necessarily imply finality of money as this depends on other factors such as the payment system used, the completion of the end- to-end transaction and the terms agreed between account servicer and owner.
Status Booked is the only status that can be reversed.Booked means that the transfer of money has been completed between account servicer and account owner
Usage :
Status Booked does not necessarily imply finality of money as this depends on other factors such as the payment system used, the completion of the end- to-end transaction and the terms agreed between account servicer and owner.
Status Booked is the only status that can be reversed.

Name: Pending
Definition:
Booking on the account owner's account in the account servicer's ledger has not been completed.
Usage : this can be used for expected items, or for items for which some conditions still need to be fulfilled before they can be booked. If booking takes place, the entry will be included with status Booked in subsequent account report or statement. Status Pending cannot be reversed.Booking on the account owner's account in the account servicer's ledger has not been completed.
Usage : this can be used for expected items, or for items for which some conditions still need to be fulfilled before they can be booked. If booking takes place, the entry will be included with status Booked in subsequent account report or statement. Status Pending cannot be reversed.Booking on the account owner's account in the account servicer's ledger has not been completed.
Usage : this can be used for expected items, or for items for which some conditions still need to be fulfilled before they can be booked. If booking takes place, the entry will be included with status Booked in subsequent account report or statement. Status Pending cannot be reversed.

Name: IBAN
Definition: An identifier used internationally by financial institutions to uniquely identify the account of a customer at a financial institution, as described in the latest edition of the international standard ISO 13616. "Banking and related financial services - International Bank Account Number (IBAN)".

Name: SortCodeAccountNumber
Definition:
Sort Code and Account Number - identifier scheme used in the UK by financial institutions to identify the account of a customer. The identifier is the concatenation of the 6 digit UK sort code and 8 digit account number.
The regular expression for this identifier is: ^[0-9]{6}[0-9]{8}$Sort Code and Account Number - identifier scheme used in the UK by financial institutions to identify the account of a customer. The identifier is the concatenation of the 6 digit UK sort code and 8 digit account number.
The regular expression for this identifier is: ^[0-9]{6}[0-9]{8}$

Name: Active
Definition: The direct debit mandate is active.

Name: Inactive
Definition: The direct debit mandate is inactive.

Name: BICFI
Definition: Valid BICs for financial institutions are registered by the ISO 9362 Registration Authority in the BIC directory, and consist of eight (8) or eleven (11) contiguous characters.

Name: Pre-Agreed
Definition: The amount of an arranged lending limit that has been agreed with the account holder

Name: Temporary
Definition: The amount of a temporary lending limit that has been agreed with the account holder

Name: Emergency
Definition: The amount of an arranged lending limit that can be borrowed on top of pre-agreed lending, that has been agreed with the account holder.

Name: ReadAccountsBasic
Definition: Permission to read basic account information.

Name: ReadAccountsDetail
Definition: Access to additional elements in the account payload.

Name: ReadBalances
Definition: Permission to read all balance information.

Name: ReadBeneficiariesBasic
Definition: Permission to read basic beneficiary details.

Name: ReadBeneficiariesDetail
Definition: Access to additional elements in the beneficiaries payload.

Name: ReadDirectDebits
Definition: Permission to read all direct debit information.

Name: ReadStandingOrdersBasic
Definition: Permission to read standing order information.

Name: ReadStandingOrdersDetail
Definition: Access to additional elements in the standing-orders payload.

Name: ReadTransactionsBasic
Definition: Permission to read basic transaction information.

Name: ReadTransactionsDetail
Definition: Access to additional elements in the transactions payload.

Name: ReadTransactionsCredits
Definition: Access to only credit transactions.

Name: ReadTransactionsDebits
Definition: Access to only debit transactions.

Name: ReadProducts
Definition: Permission to read all product information.

Name: BCA
Definition: Business Current Account

Name: PCA
Definition: Personal Current Account

Name: Authorised
Definition: The account request has been successfully authorised.

Name: AwaitingAuthorisation
Definition: The account request is awaiting further authorisation.

Name: Rejected
Definition: The account request has been rejected.

Name: Revoked
Definition: The account request has been revoked via the ASPSP interface.
